quotes.quote: He spits out secrets like hot custard.
If you've got a big mouth and you're controversial, you're going to get attention.
An indiscreet man is more hurtful than an ill-natured one; for as the latter will only attack his enemies, and those he wishes ill to, the other injures indifferently both friends and foes.
The talkative man speaks from his mouth, the eloquent man speaks from his heart.
A talkative person runs himself upon great inconvenience by blabbing out his own and others' secrets.
The talkative listen to no one, for they are ever speaking. And the first evil that attends those who know not to be silent is that they hear nothing.
Look who's here--big mouth. Now the whole neighborhood will know.
You don't talk much, do you?' she blurted out. 'I didn't think there was a need. You seem to be holding up both our ends of the conversation admirably.'
Before opening your mouth to talk, you should open your mind to think.
But far numerous was the Herd of such Who think too little and who talk too much.
A talker neither listens nor learns.
A talkative bird will not build a nest.
I got in trouble my whole life for having a big mouth.
I have a really big mouth, I have a lot of opinions and I will be heard.
It requires two indiscreet persons to institute a quarrel; one individual cannot quarrel alone.
